name: Clipmap
description:
A 3D geometry clipmap.

Finds world octants that are close to the viewer and arranges them in
concentric LOD shells. Octants that leave or enter a shell are reported for
further processing.

description: Constructs a new clipmap.

name: world
description: The world octree.

name: position
description: The current view position.

name: currentScene
description: The current scene.

name: previousScene

name: nextScene
description: The next scene.

name: update
description: Updates the clipmap.

name: process
description:
Generates voxel data for the cells in the current scene and contours them
to extract a polygonal mesh.

name: clear
description: Clears this clipmap.

Queue

A FIFO queue.

Elements are added to the end of the queue and removed from the front.

Based on:
 http://code.stephenmorley.org/javascript/queues/

description: Copies the given queue.

name: clone
description: Clones this queue.

name: add
description: Adds an element to the queue.

name: peek
description: Retrieves, but does not remove, the head of the queue.

return.description: The head of the queue, or undefined if the queue is empty.

name: poll
description: Retrieves and removes the head of the queue.

return.description: The head of the queue, or undefined if the queue is empty.

name: clear
description: Resets this queue.

name: src/core/Serializable.js
content:
/**
 * The Serializable contract.
 *
 * Implemented by objects that can provide a flat representation of the data
 * they contain.
 *
 * @interface
 */

export class Serializable {

	/**
	 * Serialises this data.
	 *
	 * @param {Boolean} [deflate=false] - Whether the data should be compressed if possible.
	 * @return {Object} The serialised data.
	 */

	serialize(deflate = false) {}

}

name: Serializable
description:
The Serializable contract.

Implemented by objects that can provide a flat representation of the data
they contain.

name: serialize
description: Serialises this data.

params.name: deflate
params.description: Whether the data should be compressed if possible.

modificationstart

Signals the start of a modification task.

This event is dispatched by {@link Terrain}.

name: modificationend
description:
Signals the end of a modification task.

This event is dispatched by {@link Terrain}.

name: extractionstart
description:
Signals the start of an extraction task.

This event is dispatched by {@link Terrain}.

name: extractionend
description:
Signals the end of an extraction task.

This event is dispatched by {@link Terrain}.

name: load
description:
Signals the end of a volume data loading process.

This event is dispatched by {@link Terrain}.

name: error
description:
Signals the occurrence of an unexpected error.

This event is dispatched by {@link Terrain}.

name: src/core/Terrain.js
Terrain
description:
The terrain system.

Manages volume modifications and mesh generation.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new terrain.

params.name: options.workers
params.description: Limits the amount of active workers. Cannot exceed the amount of logical processors.

params.name: options.resolution
params.description: The resolution of the volume data.

params.name: options.world
params.description: Additional world octree settings. See {@link WorldOctree} for details.

name: object
description: The terrain mesh. Add this object to your scene.

name: world
description: The world octree.

name: clipmap
description: A clipmap.

name: threadPool
description:
A thread pool. Each worker from this pool is capable of performing
isosurface extractions as well as CSG operations on discrete volume data.

name: tasks
description:
Keeps track of tasks that are currently being processed by a worker.

Note: The amount of tracked tasks cannot exceed the amount of workers.

name: sdfLoader
description: An SDF loader.

name: history
description:
A chronological sequence of CSG operations that have been executed during
this session.

name: dtSq
description:
A squared distance threshold.

If the squared distance from the current view position to a given new
position is greater than this threshold, the clipmap will be updated.

name: handleEvent
description: Handles events.

name: applyCSG
description:
Executes the given SDF.

SDFs without a valid CSG operation type will be ignored.
See {@link OperationType} for a list of available CSG operation types.

Instead of using this method directly, it's recommended to use the
convenience methods {@link union}, {@link subtract} and {@link intersect}.

name: union
description: Executes the given SDF and adds the generated data to the volume.

name: subtract
description: Executes the given SDF and subtracts the generated data from the volume.

name: intersect
description:
Executes the given SDF and discards the volume data that doesn't overlap
with the generated data.

name: update
description:
Updates the terrain geometry.

This method should be called every time the position has changed.

name: raycast
description: Finds the world cells that intersect with the given ray.

return.description: A list of intersecting world octants. Sorted by distance, closest first.

name: clear
description: Resets this terrain by removing all data and closing active worker threads.

name: dispose
description:
Frees internal resources.

By calling this method the terrain system will become unoperative.

name: revive
description: Revives the given serialised SDFs and applies them to the current volume.

name: save
description: Saves a description of the current volume data.

return.description: A URL to the exported save data, or null if there is no data.

name: load
description:
Loads a volume data description.

A load event will be dispatched when the loading process has finished.

params.name: data
params.description: A stringified list of SDF descriptions.

name: src/core/TransferableContainer.js
content:
/**
 * The TransferableContainer contract.
 *
 * Implemented by objects that can list their internal transferable objects.
 *
 * @interface
 */

export class TransferableContainer {

	/**
	 * Creates a list of transferable items.
	 *
	 * The `Transferable` interface represents an object that can be transferred
	 * between different execution contexts, like the main thread and Web Workers.
	 *
	 * For example, `Worker.postMessage()` takes an optional array of
	 * `Transferable` objects to transfer ownership of. If the ownership of an
	 * object is transferred, it becomes unusable (neutered) in the context it was
	 * sent from and becomes available only to the worker it was sent to.
	 * `Transferable` objects are instances of classes like `ArrayBuffer`,
	 * `MessagePort` or `ImageBitmap`.
	 *
	 * @param {Array} [transferList] - An optional target list. The transferable items will be added to this list.
	 * @return {Transferable[]} The transfer list. Null is not an acceptable value for the transferList.
	 */

	createTransferList(transferList = []) {}

}

name: TransferableContainer
description:
The TransferableContainer contract.

Implemented by objects that can list their internal transferable objects.

name: createTransferList
description:
Creates a list of transferable items.

The `Transferable` interface represents an object that can be transferred
between different execution contexts, like the main thread and Web Workers.

For example, `Worker.postMessage()` takes an optional array of
`Transferable` objects to transfer ownership of. If the ownership of an
object is transferred, it becomes unusable (neutered) in the context it was
sent from and becomes available only to the worker it was sent to.
`Transferable` objects are instances of classes like `ArrayBuffer`,
`MessagePort` or `ImageBitmap`.

params.name: transferList
params.description: An optional target list. The transferable items will be added to this list.

return.description: The transfer list. Null is not an acceptable value for the transferList.

name: load

Loads the given serialised SDFs but doesn't fully revive them.

This loader will emit a `load` event when all SDFs have been inflated. The
descriptions can then safely be revived using the {@link SDFReviver}.

params.name: descriptions
params.description: A list of serialised SDF. The individual descriptions will be inflated.

name: src/math/QEFSolver.js
p
description: A point.

name: calculateError
description: Computes the error of the approximated position.

name: QEFSolver
description:
A Quaratic Error Function solver.

Finds a point inside a voxel that minimises the sum of the squares of the
distances to the surface intersection planes associated with the voxel.

Based on an implementation by Leonard Ritter and Nick Gildea:
 https://github.com/nickgildea/qef

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new QEF solver.

name: data
description: QEF data. Will be used destructively.

name: ata
description: ATA.

name: atb
description: ATb.

name: massPoint
description: The mass point of the current QEF data set.

name: hasSolution
description: Indicates whether this solver has a solution.

name: setData
description: Sets the QEF data.

name: solve
description: Solves the Quadratic Error Function.

params.name: x
params.description: A target vector to store the vertex position in.

return.description: The quadratic error of the solution.

PSEUDOINVERSE_THRESHOLD

name: m

name: a

name: b
description: A vector that holds the singular values.

name: rotate01
description: Rotates the matrix element from the first row, second column.

name: rotate02
description: Rotates the matrix element from the first row, third column.

name: rotate12
description: Rotates the matrix element from the second row, third column.

name: solveSymmetric
description: Calculates the singular values.

name: invert
description: Computes the pseudo inverse of a given value.

name: pseudoInverse
description: Calculates the pseudo inverse of v using the singular values.

name: SingularValueDecomposition
description:
A Singular Value Decomposition solver.

Decomposes the given linear system into the matrices U, D and V and solves
the equation: U D V^T x = b.

See http://mathworld.wolfram.com/SingularValueDecomposition.html for more
information.

name: solve
description: Performs the Singular Value Decomposition to solve the given linear system.

params.name: x
params.description: A target vector to store the result in.

A bigger threshold allows more voxel cells to collapse which results in

name: src/octree/world/index.js
src/octree/world/IntermediateWorldOctant.js
IntermediateWorldOctant
description:
A world octant that doesn't reside in LOD zero.

This octant is a container for resampled volume data. Additionally, it stores
information about the existence of its potential children.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new intermediate world octant.

name: children
description:
An 8-bit mask that indicates the existence of the eight potential
children.

The order of the children follows the common octant layout from the
external `sparse-octree` module:

```text
   3____7
 2/___6/|
 | 1__|_5
 0/___4/
```

name: src/octree/world/KeyDesign.js
DWORD_BITS
description: The amount of bits of a DWord.

name: RANGE_DWORD
description: The amount of different values that can be represented with a DWord.

name: BITS
description: The total amount of available bits for safe integers.

name: HI_BITS
description:
The amount of available high bits.

In JavaScript, bit operations can only be applied to DWords (32-bit).
All 53-bit keys must be split into a high and a low part for processing.

name: LO_BITS
description:
The amount of available low bits.

In JavaScript, bit operations can only be applied to DWords (32-bit).
All 53-bit keys must be split into a high and a low part for processing.

name: KeyDesign
description:
A design for octant keys.

3D coordinates are packed into a single integer to obtain a unique key. This
class describes the bit allotment for each coordinate and provides methods
for key packing and unpacking.

See {@link KeyDesign.BITS} for the total amount of available bits.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new key design.

params.name: x
params.description: The amount of bits used for the X-coordinate.

params.name: y
params.description: The amount of bits used for the Y-coordinate.

params.name: z
params.description: The amount of bits used for the Z-coordinate.

name: x
description: The amount of bits reserved for the X-coordinate.

name: y
description: The amount of bits reserved for the Y-coordinate.

name: z
description: The amount of bits reserved for the Z-coordinate.

name: rangeX
description: The amount of distinct integers that can be represented with X bits.

name: rangeY
description: The amount of distinct integers that can be represented with Y bits.

name: rangeZ
description: The amount of distinct integers that can be represented with Z bits.

name: rangeXY
description: The amount of distinct integers that can be represented with X + Y bits.

name: halfRange
description: The key range divided by two.

name: maskX
description:
A bit mask for the X-coordinate. The first item holds the low bits while
the second item holds the high bits.

name: maskY
description:
A bit mask for the Y-coordinate. The first item holds the low bits while
the second item holds the high bits.

name: maskZ
description:
A bit mask for the Z-coordinate. The first item holds the low bits while
the second item holds the high bits.

name: set
description:
Sets the bit distribution.

Make sure to clear your octree after changing the key design!

params.name: x
params.description: The amount of bits used for the X-coordinate.

params.name: y
params.description: The amount of bits used for the Y-coordinate.

params.name: z
params.description: The amount of bits used for the Z-coordinate.

name: updateBitMasks
description: Creates bit masks for the extraction of coordinates from keys.

name: unpackKey
description: Extracts the 3D coordinates from a given key.

params.name: target
params.description: A target for the extracted coordinates. If none is provided, a new vector will be created.

name: packKey
description: Packs a 3D position into a unique key.

name: keyRange
description:
Returns a new key range iterator.

The key iterator will return all keys in the specified coordinate range,
including those at min and max.

params.name: min
params.description: The lower key index bounds (zero-based unsigned integer coordinates).

params.name: max
params.description: The upper key index bounds (zero-based unsigned integer coordinates).

name: toString
description: Converts the information of this key design into a string.

return.description: The key design as a string.

name: BITS
description:
The total amount of available bits for safe integers.

JavaScript uses IEEE 754 binary64 Doubles for Numbers and, as a result,
only supports 53-bit integers as of ES2015.

For more information see: http://2ality.com/2012/04/number-encoding.html

name: HI_BITS
description:
The amount of available bits in the high DWord.

In JavaScript, bit operations can only be applied to DWords (32-bit).
All 53-bit keys must be split into a high and a low part for processing.

name: LO_BITS
description:
The amount of available bits in the low DWord.

In JavaScript, bit operations can only be applied to DWords (32-bit).
All 53-bit keys must be split into a high and a low part for processing.

KeyIterator

Constructs a new key iterator.

This iterator returns all keys in the specified coordinate range, including
those at min and max.

params.name: min

params.name: max
params.description: The upper index bounds (zero-based unsigned integer coordinates).

name: keyDesign
description: The key design.

name: min
description: The lower index bounds.

name: max
description: The upper index bounds.

name: keyBase
description: The base key coordinates.

name: key
description: The current key iteration coordinates.

name: limit
description: The iteration limits.

name: result
description: An iterator result.

name: reset
description: Resets this iterator.

name: next
description: Iterates over the key range.

name: return
description: Called when this iterator will no longer be run to completion.

name: [Symbol.iterator]
description: Returns this iterator.

name: src/octree/world/WorldOctant.js
WorldOctant
description:
A world octant.

This octant serves as a volume data container. Its position is implicitly
defined by its key while its size is defined by the LOD grid in which it
resides. Additionally, it can store a queue of pending CSG operations.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new world octant.

name: data
description: Hermite data.

name: csg
description:
A CSG operation queue.

If this queue is not empty, the volume data has to be modified before it
can be contoured.

name: isosurface
description: A generated isosurface mesh.

WorldOctantId
description:
A world octant identifier.

Each octant can be identified by a LOD index and a positional key.

name: lod
description: The LOD grid in which the world octant resides.

name: key
description: The unique key of the world octant.

name: set
description: Sets the LOD index and key.

name: copy
description: Copies the given octant identifier.

name: clone
description: Clones this octant identifier.

name: src/octree/world/WorldOctantIterator.js
WorldOctantIterator
description: A world octant iterator.

name: constructor

name: WorldOctree
description:
An octree that subdivides space for fast spatial searches.

The purpose of this linear octree is to efficiently organise volume data. It
allows direct access to different LOD layers, octant neighbours and parents.

The world octree is axis-aligned and cannot be rotated.

name: constructor
description:
Constructs a new world octree.

Each octant can be uniquely identified by a 3D coordinate and a LOD value.
The individual values for X, Y and Z are combined into a 53-bit key.

params.name: cellSize
params.description: The size of the smallest octants in LOD zero. Must be an integer i such that 0 < i < 2 ** (33 - levels).

params.name: levels
params.description: The amount of detail levels. Must be an integer i such that 0 < i < 33.

params.name: keyDesign
params.description: The bit allotments for the octant coordinates.

name: cellSize
description: The LOD zero cell size.

name: keyDesign
description: The octant key design.

name: grids
description: The octant LOD grids.

name: bounds
description: An empty octant wrapper that merely holds the bounds of this world.

name: min
description: The lower bounds of this world.

name: max
description: The upper bounds of this world.

name: levels
description: The amount of detail levels. This value can not be changed.

name: lodZero
description: The LOD zero octant grid.

name: getKeyDesign
description: Returns the key design.

name: getCellSize
description: Returns the size of the cells in the specified LOD grid.

params.name: lod
params.description: The LOD. Must be an integer; fractions will be truncated.

name: getCenter
description: Computes the center of this world.

params.name: target
params.description: A target vector. If none is provided, a new one will be created.

return.description: A vector that describes the center of this world.

name: setCenter
description:
Sets the center of this world.

Keeping the center at (0, 0, 0) is recommended because a large offset can
lead to floating point coordinate imprecisions.

name: getDimensions
description: Computes the size of this world.

params.name: target
params.description: A target vector. If none is provided, a new one will be created.

return.description: A vector that describes the size of this world.

name: getDepth
description:
The world octree depth is constant and corresponds to the amount of detail
levels.

name: getGrid
description: Returns a specific LOD grid.

return.description: The requested LOD grid or undefined if the given LOD is out of bounds.

name: clear
description: Removes all octants.

name: containsPoint
description: Checks if the given point lies inside this octree's boundaries.

return.description: Whether the given point lies inside this octree.

name: findOctantsByLevel
description: Fetches all octants of the specified LOD.

return.description: A collection that contains the octants of the specified LOD.

name: calculateKeyCoordinates
description: Calculates key coordinates based on a given position and LOD.

params.name: target
params.description: A vector to store the result in. If none is provided, a new one will be created.

name: getOctantByPoint
description: Retrieves the octant of a specific LOD that contains the given point.

return.description: The octant that contains the point or undefined if it doesn't exist.

name: removeOctant
description:
Removes a specific octant by a given key.

Children and empty parent nodes will be removed as well.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the octant that should be removed.

name: applyCSG
description: Applies the given SDF to the affected octants.

name: raycast
description:
Finds the octants that intersect with the given ray. The intersecting
octants are sorted by distance, closest first. Empty octants will not be
included in the result.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An optional target list to be filled with the intersecting octants.

name: octants
description:
Returns a new world octant iterator.

The octants returned by this iterator are augmented with explicit
positional information. See {@link WorldOctantWrapper} for more details.

name: calculateOffsetIndex
description:
Calculates an offset index from octant key coordinates.

The index identifies the octant's positional offset relative to its parent:

```text
 0: [0, 0, 0]
 1: [0, 0, 1]
 2: [0, 1, 0]
 3: [0, 1, 1]
 4: [1, 0, 0]
 5: [1, 0, 1]
 6: [1, 1, 0]
 7: [1, 1, 1]
```

Note: This binary pattern is defined by the external sparse-octree module.

For more information on fast bitwise modulo with power of two divisors see:
 https://graphics.stanford.edu/~seander/bithacks.html#ModulusDivisionEasy

params.name: x
params.description: The X-coordinate of the octant key.

params.name: y
params.description: The Y-coordinate of the octant key.

params.name: z
params.description: The Z-coordinate of the octant key.

return.description: The index of the relative position offset. Range: [0, 7].

v
description: A vector.

description: A line.

name: b
description: A box.

name: d
description: A box.

description: A ray.

name: octantTable
description:
A lookup-table containing octant ids. Used to determine the exit plane from
an octant.

name: flags
description: A byte that stores raycasting flags.

name: findEntryOctant
description:
Finds the entry plane of the first octant that a ray travels through.

Determining the first octant requires knowing which of the t0s is the
largest. The tms of the other axes must also be compared against that
largest t0.

return.description: The index of the first octant that the ray travels through.

name: findNextOctant
description:
Finds the next octant that intersects with the ray based on the exit plane of
the current one.

params.name: currentOctant
params.description: The index of the current octant.

return.description: The index of the next octant that the ray travels through.

name: raycastOctant
description:
Recursively traverses the given octant to find (pseudo) leaf octants that
intersect with the given ray.

params.name: keyX
params.description: The X-coordinate of the current octant key.

params.name: keyY
params.description: The Y-coordinate of the current octant key.

params.name: keyZ
params.description: The Z-coordinate of the current octant key.

params.name: tx0
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial tx0 = (minX - rayOriginX) / rayDirectionX.

params.name: ty0
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial ty0 = (minY - rayOriginY) / rayDirectionY.

params.name: tz0
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial tz0 = (minZ - rayOriginZ) / rayDirectionZ.

params.name: tx1
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial tx1 = (maxX - rayOriginX) / rayDirectionX.

params.name: ty1
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial ty1 = (maxY - rayOriginY) / rayDirectionY.

params.name: tz1
params.description: Ray projection parameter. Initial tz1 = (maxZ - rayOriginZ) / rayDirectionZ.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An array to be filled with the intersecting octants.

name: intersectSubtree
description:
Finds (pseudo) leaf octants in the given subtree that intersect with the
given ray.

params.name: subtree
params.description: A world octant, enriched with positional information.

params.name: keyCoordinates
params.description: The key coordinates of the octant.

params.name: intersects
params.description: The intersecting octants. Sorted by distance, closest first

name: WorldOctreeRaycaster
description:
A world octree raycaster.

This raycaster is a specialised hybrid that uses a voxel traversal algorithm
to iterate over the octants of the highest LOD grid and an octree traversal
algorithm to raycast the identified subtrees.

The voxel traversal implementation is a 3D supercover variant of the Digital
Differential Analyzer (DDA) line algorithm and is similar to the Bresenham
algorithm. The octree traversal algorithm relies on octant child existence
information to skip empty space and to avoid hashmap lookup misses.

References:

 "Voxel Traversal along a 3D Line"
 by D. Cohen (1994)

 "An Efficient Parametric Algorithm for Octree Traversal"
 by J. Revelles et al. (2000)

name: intersectWorldOctree
description: Finds (pseudo) leaf octants that intersect with the given ray.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An optional target list to be filled with the intersecting octants.

return.description: The intersecting octants. Sorted by distance, closest first.

name: src/volume/EdgeData.js
EdgeData
description:
Stores edge data separately for each dimension.

With a grid resolution N, there are `3 * (N + 1) * N` edges in total, but
the number of edges that actually contain the volume's surface is usually
much lower.

name: constructor
description: Constructs new edge data.

params.name: x
params.description: The amount of edges along the X-axis. If <= 0, no memory will be allocated.

params.name: y
params.description: The amount of edges along the Y-axis. If omitted, this will be the same as x.

params.name: z
params.description: The amount of edges along the Z-axis. If omitted, this will be the same as x.

name: resolution
description: The material grid resolution.

name: indices
description:
The edges.

Edges are stored as starting grid point indices in ascending order. The
ending point indices are implicitly defined through the dimension split:

Given a starting point index A, the ending point index B for the X-, Y-
and Z-axis is defined as `A + 1`, `A + N` and `A + N` respectively where
N is the grid resolution + 1.

name: zeroCrossings
description:
The Zero Crossing interpolation values.

Each value describes the relative surface intersection position on the
respective edge. The values correspond to the order of the edges.

name: normals
description:
The surface intersection normals.

The vectors are stored as [x, y, z] float triples and correspond to the
order of the edges.

name: serialize
description: Serialises this data.

params.name: deflate
params.description: Whether the data should be compressed if possible.

name: deserialize
description: Adopts the given serialised data.

params.name: object
params.description: Serialised edge data. Can be null.

return.description: This object or null if the given serialised data was null.

The effective resolution of a chunk of Hermite data is the distance between

The upper limit is 256.

src/volume/sdf/SDFReviver.js
SDFReviver
description: An SDF reviver.

name: revive
description: Creates an SDF from the given serialised description.

name: src/volume/sdf/SDFType.js
SDFType
description: An enumeration of SDF types.

name: src/volume/sdf/SignedDistanceFunction.js
m
description: A matrix.

name: SignedDistanceFunction
description:
An abstract Signed Distance Function.

An SDF describes the signed Euclidean distance to the surface of an object,
effectively describing its density at every point in 3D space. It yields
negative values for points that lie inside the volume and positive values
for points outside. The value is zero at the exact boundary of the object.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new base SDF.

params.name: material
params.description: A material index. Must be an integer in the range of 1 to 255.

name: type
description: The type of this SDF.

name: operation
description: The operation type.

name: material
description: A material index.

name: boundingBox
description: The axis-aligned bounding box of this SDF.

name: position
description:
The positional translation.

Call {@link updateInverseTransformation} after changing this field.

name: quaternion
description:
The rotation.

Call {@link updateInverseTransformation} after changing this field.

name: scale
description:
The scale.

Call {@link updateInverseTransformation} after changing this field.

name: inverseTransformation
description: The inverted transformation matrix.

name: children
description:
A list of SDFs.

SDFs can be chained to build CSG expressions.

name: getTransformation
description:
Composes a transformation matrix using the translation, rotation and scale
of this SDF.

The transformation matrix is not needed for most SDF calculations and is
therefore not stored explicitly to save space.

params.name: target
params.description: A target matrix. If none is provided, a new one will be created.

name: getBoundingBox
description: Calculates the AABB of this SDF if it doesn't exist yet and returns it.

params.name: recursive
params.description: Whether the child SDFs should be taken into account.

name: setMaterial
description: Sets the material.

params.name: material
params.description: The material. Must be an integer in the range of 1 to 255.

name: setOperationType
description: Sets the CSG operation type of this SDF.

name: updateInverseTransformation
description:
Updates the inverse transformation matrix.

This method should be called after the position, quaternion or scale has
changed. The bounding box will be updated automatically.

name: union
description: Adds the given SDF to this one.

name: subtract
description: Subtracts the given SDF from this one.

name: intersect
description: Intersects the given SDF with this one.

name: toCSG
description: Translates this SDF into a CSG expression.

name: serialize
description: Serialises this SDF.

params.name: deflate
params.description: Whether the data should be compressed if possible.

name: createTransferList
description: Creates a list of transferable items.

params.name: transferList
params.description: An optional target list. The transferable items will be added to this list.

name: toJSON
description: Returns a plain object that describes this SDF.

return.description: A simple description of this SDF.

name: computeBoundingBox
description: Calculates the bounding box of this SDF.

throws.description: An error is thrown if the method is not overridden.

name: sample
description: Samples the volume's density at the given point in space.

return.description: The Euclidean distance to the surface.

throws.description: An error is thrown if the method is not overridden.

name: src/volume/sdf/SuperPrimitive.js
SuperPrimitive
description:
The super primitive.

A function that is able to represent a wide range of conic/rectangular-radial
primitives of genus 0 and 1: (round) box, sphere, cylinder, capped cone,
torus, capsule, pellet, pipe, etc.

Reference:
 https://www.shadertoy.com/view/MsVGWG

name: constructor
description:
Constructs a new super primitive.

See {@link SuperPrimitivePreset} for a list of default configurations.

params.name: parameters.s
params.description: The size and genus weight [x, y, z, w].

name: s0
description: The base size. The W-component affects the genus of the primitive.

name: r0
description: The base corner radii.

name: s
description: The size, adjusted for further calculations.

name: r
description: The corner radii, adjusted for further calculations.

name: ba
description: Precomputed corner rounding constants.

name: offset
description: The bottom radius offset.

name: setSize
description: Sets the size and genus weight.

name: setRadii
description: Sets the corner radii.

name: precompute
description: Precomputes corner rounding factors.

name: computeBoundingBox
description: Calculates the bounding box of this SDF.

name: sample
description: Samples the volume's density at the given point in space.

return.description: The euclidean distance to the surface.

name: serialize
description: Serialises this SDF.

params.name: deflate
params.description: Whether the data should be compressed if possible.

name: create
description: Creates a new primitive using the specified preset.

name: superPrimitivePresets
description: A list of parameter presets.

name: SuperPrimitivePreset
description: An enumeration of super primitive presets.

name: src/volume/Voxel.js
Voxel
description: A cubic voxel that holds information about the surface of a volume.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new voxel.

name: materials
description:
Holds binary material information about all eight corners of this voxel.

A value of 0 means that this voxel is completely outside of the volume,
whereas a value of 255 means that it's fully inside of it. Any other
value indicates a material change which implies that the voxel contains
the surface.

name: edgeCount
description: The amount of edges that exhibit a material change in this voxel.

name: index
description:
A generated index for this voxel's vertex. Used during the construction
of the final polygons.

name: position
description: The vertex that lies inside this voxel.

name: normal
description: The normal of the vertex that lies inside this voxel.

name: qefData
description: A QEF data construct. Used to calculate the vertex position.

name: src/worker/Action.js
Action
description: An enumeration of worker actions.

name: src/worker/DataProcessor.js
data
description: An empty set of Hermite data.

name: DataProcessor
description: A volume data processor.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new data processor.

name: data
description: A set of Hermite data that will be used during processing.

name: response
description: A container for the data that will be returned to the main thread.

name: getData
description: Returns the data of this processor.

name: respond
description:
Prepares a response that can be send back to the main thread.

Should be used together with {@link DataProcessor#createTransferList}.

name: createTransferList
description: Creates a list of transferable items.

params.name: transferList
params.description: An optional target list. The transferable items will be added to this list.

name: process
description: Processes the given request.

name: src/worker/index.js
src/worker/messages/ConfigurationMessage.js
ConfigurationMessage
description: A configuration message.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new configuration message.

name: resolution
description: The global grid resolution of the Hermite data chunks.

name: errorThreshold
description: An error threshold for QEF-based mesh simplification.

name: src/worker/messages/DataMessage.js
DataMessage
description: A worker message that contains transferable data.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new data message.

name: data
description: A serialised data container.

name: src/worker/messages/ExtractionRequest.js
ExtractionRequest
description: An extraction request.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new extraction request.

name: src/worker/messages/ExtractionResponse.js
ExtractionResponse
description: An extraction response.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new extraction response.

name: isosurface
description: A serialised isosurface.

name: src/worker/messages/index.js
src/worker/messages/Message.js
Message
description:
A message.

Messages are exchanged between different execution contexts such as a worker
and the main thread.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new message.

name: action
description:
A worker action.

When a message is sent to another execution context, it will be copied
using the Structured Clone algorithm. This automatic process turns the
message into a plain object. The explicit action flag serves as a
reliable identifier.

name: error
description:
An error.

If this is not null, something went wrong.

name: src/worker/messages/ModificationRequest.js
ModificationRequest
description: A modification request.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new modification request.

name: sdf
description: A serialised SDF.

name: cellSize
description: The world size of the volume data cell.

name: cellPosition
description:
The world positions of the volume data cell.

Together with the world size, this base position describes the region of
the volume data cell in world space.

name: src/worker/messages/ModificationResponse.js
ModificationResponse
description: A modification response.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new modification response.

name: sdf
description: A serialised SDF.

name: src/worker/SurfaceExtractor.js
SurfaceExtractor
description: A surface extractor that generates a polygonal mesh from Hermite data.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new surface extractor.

name: response
description: A container for the data that will be returned to the main thread.

name: decompressionTarget
description: A target container for decompressed data.

name: isosurface
description: The result of the isosurface extraction process.

name: respond
description:
Prepares a response that can be send back to the main thread.

Should be used together with {@link SurfaceExtractor#createTransferList}.

name: createTransferList
description: Creates a list of transferable items.

params.name: transferList
params.description: An optional target list. The transferable items will be added to this list.

name: process
description: Extracts a surface from the given Hermite data.

name: src/worker/thread-pool-events.js
message
description:
A worker message event.

This event is dispatched by {@link ThreadPool}.

name: src/worker/ThreadPool.js
ThreadPool
description: Manages worker threads.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new thread pool.

params.name: maxWorkers
params.description: Limits the amount of active workers. The default limit is the amount of logical processors.

name: workerURL
description: An object URL that points to the worker program.

name: maxWorkers
description: The maximum number of active worker threads.

name: workers
description: A list of existing workers.

name: busyWorkers
description: Keeps track of workers that are currently busy.

name: configurationMessage
description:
A configuration message.

This object will be sent to each newly created worker.

name: handleEvent
description: Handles events.

name: closeWorker
description: Closes a worker.

name: createWorker
description: Creates a new worker.

name: getWorker
description:
Polls an available worker and returns it. The worker will be excluded from
subsequent polls until it finishes its task and sends a message back.

return.description: A worker or null if all resources are currently exhausted.

name: clear
description: Resets this thread pool by closing all workers.

name: dispose
description: Removes all active workers and releases the worker program blob.

name: src/worker/VolumeModifier.js
VolumeModifier
description: A modifier that applies CSG operations to Hermite data.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new Hermite data modifier.

name: response
description: A container for the data that will be returned to the main thread.

name: sdf
description: An SDF.

name: respond
description:
Prepares a response that can be send back to the main thread.

Should be used together with {@link VolumeModifier#createTransferList}.

name: createTransferList
description: Creates a list of transferable items.

params.name: transferList
params.description: An optional target list. The transferable items will be added to this list.

name: process
description: Modifies the given Hermite data using the provided SDF.

name: src/worker/worker.js
volumeModifier
description: A volume modifier.

name: surfaceExtractor
description: A surface extractor.

name: action
description: The current action.

name: ./README.md

content:
{
	"name": "rabbit-hole",
	"version": "0.0.0",
	"description": "A volumetric terrain engine.",
	"homepage": "https://github.com/vanruesc/rabbit-hole",
	"main": "build/rabbit-hole.js",
	"module": "src/index.js",
	"sideEffects": false,
	"license": "Zlib",

	"keywords": [
		"volumetric",
		"voxel",
		"engine",
		"isosurface",
		"contouring",
		"terrain"
	],

	"author": {
		"name": "Raoul van Rschen",
		"email": "vanruesc@outlook.de"
	},

	"repository": {
		"type": "git",
		"url": "https://github.com/vanruesc/rabbit-hole.git"
	},

	"bugs": {
		"url": "https://github.com/vanruesc/rabbit-hole/issues"
	},

	"files": [
		"src",
		"build"
	],

	"scripts": {
		"ava": "ava",
		"lint": "npm run lint:lib && npm run lint:demo && npm run lint:editor && npm run lint:performance && npm run lint:test",
		"lint:config": "eslint *.js",
		"lint:experiment": "eslint experiment",
		"lint:lib": "eslint src",
		"lint:demo": "eslint demo/src",
		"lint:editor": "eslint editor/src",
		"lint:performance": "eslint performance/src",
		"lint:test": "eslint test",
		"build": "rollup -c",
		"build:production": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production rollup -c",
		"doc": "esdoc",
		"deploy": "npm run deploy:demo && npm run deploy:editor && npm run deploy:performance",
		"deploy:demo": "cpx demo/assets/** public/demo",
		"deploy:editor": "cpx editor/assets/** public/editor",
		"deploy:performance": "cpx performance/assets/** public/performance",
		"pretest": "npm run lint && npm run build:production",
		"test": "npm run ava",
		"prepack": "npm test && inline-import",
		"postpublish": "inline-import -r"
	},

	"ava": {
		"failFast": true,
		"files": ["test/**/*.js"]
	},

	"eslintConfig": {
		"extends": "delta"
	},

	"peerDependencies": {
		"iterator-result": ">= 0.0.0 < 1.0.0",
		"math-ds": ">= 1.0.0 < 2.0.0",
		"sparse-octree": ">= 5.0.0 < 6.0.0",
		"synthetic-event": ">= 0.0.0 < 1.0.0"
	},

	"devDependencies": {
		"@babel/core": "7.x.x",
		"@babel/preset-env": "7.x.x",
		"ava": "0.x.x",
		"cpx": "1.x.x",
		"cross-env": "5.x.x",
		"dat.gui": "0.x.x",
		"delta-controls": "2.x.x",
		"esdoc": "1.x.x",
		"esdoc-standard-plugin": "1.x.x",
		"eslint": "5.x.x",
		"eslint-config-delta": "0.x.x",
		"feature-detector": "0.x.x",
		"hermite-data-helper": "0.x.x",
		"inline-import": "1.x.x",
		"iterator-result": "0.x",
		"math-ds": "1.x.x",
		"octree-helper": "0.x.x",
		"rollup": "0.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-babel": "4.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-babel-minify": "6.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "3.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-string": "2.x.x",
		"sparse-octree": "5.x.x",
		"synthetic-event": "0.x.x",
		"three": "0.97.x",
		"three-demo": "3.x.x"
	}
}
name: package.json
